ALLEGATION:
A staff allowed a female resident to use his cell phone. The resident observed
an explicit photo of the staff on his phone.
INVESTIGATION:
On June 20, 2020, a special investigation was initiated regarding the complaint
described above. Staff and a resident were interviewed. Documents were also
reviewed. What follows is information obtained from the aforementioned sources.
On June 20, 2020, another DHHS Worker was contacted and the case was
discussed.
On July 7, 2020, interviews were conducted on site. Another DHHS Worker was
involved in the interviews via video conferencing.
On July 7, 2020, Resident A, a 12-year-old female, was interviewed. Resident A is
the alleged victim in this case. Resident A reported that Staff 1 had allowed her to
use his cell phone for “Tic Toc” as she was making a dance video that she wanted
to send to her caseworker. Resident A reported that while using the phone a small
picture popped up which she said she could not see clearly but it was the private
parts of a male. Resident A reported that the picture was very small and was in the
corner of the cell phone viewing window. Resident A reported that she then told
Resident B about the picture. Resident A stated that she feels safe at the program.
On July 7, 2020, Resident B was interviewed. Resident B reported that Resident A
had told her about the photo she saw on Staff 1’s cell phone. Resident B stated that
Staff 1 has let Resident A use his cell phone for “Tic Toc”. Resident B stated that
she has not used Staff 1’s phone or seen pictures on his cell phone.
On July 7, 2020, Resident C was interviewed. Resident C reported that Staff 1 will
allow Resident A to use his cell phone for “Tic Toc”. Resident C reported that she
has never used a staff persons cell phone and has not seen inappropriate pictures
on any staff’s phone.
On July 7, 2020, Resident D was interviewed. Resident D reported that staff are not
allowed to let residents use their cell phones. Resident D reported that she has not
seen staff allow a resident to use their cell phone.
On July 7, 2020, Resident E was interviewed. Resident E reported that Staff 1
allows Resident A to use his cell phone for “Tic Toc” as Resident A likes to make a
dance video for a school project. Resident E reported that she has never seen
anything inappropriate on Staff 1’s cell phone.
3

On July 22, 2020, a PCU was conducted with another DHHS Worker and Resident
A’s Foster Care Worker. The Foster Care Worker reported that Resident A is highly
sexualized and will lie and make up stories.
On August 13, 2020, Staff 1 was interviewed. Staff 1 reported that he had allowed
Resident A to use his cell phone for purposes of making a “Tic Toc” video. Staff 1
reported that for privacy purposes he closes all applications before allowing a
resident to use his cell phone. Staff reported that he did not have any pictures on
his cell phone which had sexual content. Staff 1 denied that he had a picture of a
penis on his cell phone.
Document Review:
A review of Staff 1’s personnel file does not indicate any prior disciplinary action.
The file of Resident A was reviewed. The file indicates a history of witnessing
domestic violence. The file also indicates that Resident A has poor boundaries.
Agency policies titled, “Technology Usage” and “Healthy and Professional
Boundaries When Working With Youth” were reviewed. Each policy prohibits staff
from allowing resident to use their cell phones or showing residents pictures on
their cell phone.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(a) The types of children to be admitted for care.
ANALYSIS: Evidence is insufficient to establish that Staff 1 had an
inappropriate photo on his cell phone which Resident A viewed.
Staff 1 denied that he had a picture of a penis on his cell phone.
Resident A reported that there was such a photo but that she
could not see the picture clearly.
A rule violation was established as Staff 1 allowed Resident A to
use his cell phone which is prohibited by agency policy. Staff 1
acknowledged that he allowed Resident A to use his cell phone.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
4
